result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason James Folts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges within 2 YEARS of today's date, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence, first 4 months to be served straight time, AFTER 4 MONTHS has been served defendant granted Huber, including for ARCW & for BIP.
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 1 YEAR in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, first 4 months to be served straight time, AFTER 4 MONTHS has been served defendant granted Huber, including for ARCW & for BIP. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges within 2 YEARS of today's date, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant Jason James Folts in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija. William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, but Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Court is in trial.  Branch 23 agreed to hear the matter.  rmm

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Jason James Folts not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Due to court calendar congestion, matter is adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  The 5/20/15 jury trial is vacated.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Jason James Folts not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for Final Pre-Trial.   Defense requests plea and sentencing date. Case remains calendared in Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Statement made by : Henry F. Court denied any modification of no contact order.

Attorney Gabriela A. Leija in court.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order/NO FIREARMS.  Defendant to have no contact with HENRY F.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jason James Folts in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant Jason James Folts in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 8:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
